result.title: Dissemination and communication strategy
result.description: A sound and ambitious dissemination strategy will be put in place to optimally promote the benefits of the REnnovates deep energy retrofitting approach coupled with the interoperable bi-directional solution for advanced district level operational energy services. This strategy will be discussed with action points in the kick-off meeting and will be reviewed every 6 months coinciding with the consortium meetings. This strategy will be designed to address all relevant stakeholders such as the housing corporations, construction companies and all tiers of the energy market including consumers, technology providers, energy producers, network operators etc. It will also include the exploitation synergies and networking between REnnovates and existing relevant EU and national projects and initiatives.

result.title: Report on realization of integrated light trapping structures into bottom cell
result.description: Progress report about the realization of the integration of light trapping structures into the Silicon bottom cell. This will allow current matching to the used top cell design. Special attention needs to be paid to checking the feasibility of the back-end processing. Performance of the light trapping will be confirmed by producing silicon test solar cell devices (> 1 cm2) and measurement of reflection properties and Quantum Efficiency in the spectral range of 300–1250 nm. The current enhancement induced by the light trapping structure will be at least 1 mA/cm2.

result.title: Annual data reporting
result.description: This annual data reporting will include: Engaging support for the technology: by confirming the progress of the European FCH industry and its relevance in Europe’s energy future Providing input to policy-making: identifying and justifying areas warranting policy support Gauging our position in the worldwide industry: enabling us to capitalize on strengths Orient FCH JU programme: identifying gaps that require addressing to meet objectives/targets This deliverable will be on a specific template (depending on technology, TRL etc) – to be provided by the FCH JU in a dedicated on-line platform/tool.

result.title: Report on optimized particle patterning with redesigned master structures or processing
result.description: Depending on optical simulations as well as electro-optical characterization performed in WP6 it is likely that pattern parameters (pitch, diameters or shape of particles) will need to be optimized. Also a close link to the partners doing the epitaxy in WP2 will be important to have a feedback to optimize the quality of the catalyst arrays. The report will describe the measures being taken to meet these demands.
